# pitch

**Instance Property**

The viewing angle of the camera, in degrees.

## Declaration

```swift
var pitch: CGFloat { get set }
```

## Discussion

A value of `0` results in a camera that points straight down at the map. Angles greater than `0` result in a camera that pitches toward the horizon by the specified number of degrees. If the map type is [doc://com.apple.mapkit/documentation/MapKit/MKMapType/satellite] or [doc://com.apple.mapkit/documentation/MapKit/MKMapType/hybrid], the object clamps the pitch value to `0`.

The class may clamp the value in this property to a maximum value to maintain map readability. There’s no fixed maximum value, though, because the actual maximum value is dependent on the altitude of the camera.

## Configuring the viewing angle

- **centerCoordinate**: The map coordinate at the center of the map view.
- **heading**: The heading of the camera (in degrees) relative to true north.
- **centerCoordinateDistance**: The distance from the center point of the map to the camera, in meters.
- **altitude**: The altitude above the ground, in meters.
